memberdef.argsstring: (IConfigurationManager configurationManager, IMessageSerialiser< TAuthenticationToken > messageSerialiser, IAuthenticationTokenHelper< TAuthenticationToken > authenticationTokenHelper, ICorrelationIdHelper correlationIdHelper, ILogger logger, IAzureBusHelper< TAuthenticationToken > azureBusHelper)
memberdef.name: AzureCommandBusPublisher

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command)
memberdef.name: Publish< TCommand >

briefdescription.para: Publishes the provided command on the command bus.

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command)
memberdef.name: Send< TCommand >

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< TCommand > commands)
memberdef.name: Publish< TCommand >

briefdescription.para: Publishes the provided commands on the command bus.

memberdef.argsstring: (IEnumerable< TCommand > commands)
memberdef.name: Send< TCommand >

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, int millisecondsTimeout, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent or exits if the specified timeout is expired.

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, TimeSpan timeout, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent or exits if the specified timeout is expired.

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
A T:System.TimeSpan that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, Func< IEnumerable< IEvent< TAuthenticationToken >>, TEvent > condition, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits until the specified condition is satisfied an event of TEvent

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
A delegate to be executed over and over until it returns the TEvent that is desired, return null to keep trying.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, Func< IEnumerable< IEvent< TAuthenticationToken >>, TEvent > condition, int millisecondsTimeout, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

The number of milliseconds to wait, or F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.

If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

briefdescription.para: A ICommandPublisher<TAuthenticationToken> that resolves handlers , executes the handler and then publishes the ICommand<TAuthenticationToken> on the public command bus.
